task.title: Display a seek scrub bar with the current playback position
task.shortdesc: supports seeking to a specific position (time) where the stream is a sliding-window playlist, in both video on demand (VOD) and live streams.

context.note: Seeking in a live stream is allowed only for DVR.

info.p: Seeking is asynchronous, so dispatches the following seek-related events:

ul.li: SeekEvent.SEEK_POSITION_ADJUSTED - readjusted the seek position provided by the user.

step.cmd: Wait for the player to be in a valid status for seeking.

info.p: Valid states are PREPARED, COMPLETED, PAUSED, and PLAYING.

step.cmd: Listen for the appropriate event to see when the user is scrubbing.
Pass the requested seek position (milliseconds) to the MediaPlayer.seek method.

info.p: You can seek only in the assetâ€™s seekable duration. For video on demand, the duration is from 0 through the asset's duration.
info.note: This moves the play head to a new position in the stream, but the final computed position might differ from the specified seek position.

step.cmd: Wait for to dispatch the SeekEvent.SEEK_END event.
Retrieve the final adjusted play position using event.actualPosition.

info.p:
This is important because the actual start position after the seek can be different from the requested position. Various rules might apply, including:
Playback behavior is affected if a seek or other repositioning ends in the middle of an ad break or skips ad breaks.
If you seek near a segment boundary, the seek position is adjusted to the beginning of the segment.

step.cmd: Use the position information when displaying a seek scrub bar.
